body: Rclone uses the AWS S3 SDK. Is there an AWS equipment to the IBM IAM API key? If so then it will be easy to add.

Thank you @ncw ,
I did further investigation and below is my observation.

Currently, AWS SDK does not support IBM IAM authentication/authorzation. It looks to be a difficult task to instrument the IBM IAM in AWS SDK.
However,  IBM maintains its own IBM COS SDK for GO which can be leveraged to write a new rClone backend. https://github.com/IBM/ibm-cos-sdk-go.

We would like to hear your views on this.

I'm not wildly keen on a new backend very similar to AWS. We do have one already though the oracle object storage backend - I think Oracle did a similar thing. This causes quite a bit of maintenance load, and already the two backends have diverged.

It might be be possible to build the IBM auth into a a [Go http.Transport](https://pkg.go.dev/net/http#RoundTripper) and that could slip over the AWS SDK in a much less disruptive way.

Rclone already wraps all backends with its own HTTP transport to provide things like HTTP debugging with `-vv --dump headers`, rate limiting etc so if the IBM auth can be made to work like that then it would be easy to plug in.

Hi @ncw ,
Do you have any example of the above in rClone?

Here is rclone's http transport

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/cc3ae931db7fcb9ccc0cd2f6b100ab6c62c01d82/fs/fshttp/http.go#L140-L144

And you can see that in the s3 backend it is used here

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/cc3ae931db7fcb9ccc0cd2f6b100ab6c62c01d82/backend/s3/s3.go#L2843-L2846

So all requests to and from the AWS SDK go through rclone's transport.

Thank you @ncw ,
I will take a look into this.
I will be taking a look at implementing the feature
I just merged the AWS SDKv2 in and that has some examples in it of changing the auth. I implemented a v2 signer which I think should be a good place to start to implement custom IBM auth @minbaev

Thank you @ncw 
Could you share the pr you merged?
Also in April we wanted to implement the change at rclone transport layer
With the new change should we go through signer instead? I haven't seen the pr, so asking those question to get context
@ncw thank you! will take a look

issue.title: Add IBM IAM signer

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

body:
hi @ncw had to work on smth else, thus the delay
please take a look at the pr with custom IBM IAM signer and let me know if you have questions
i have tested it with rclone lsd command and it works. can paste the output to the pr if needed
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/8157
